WRITING.TEXT:
Its $3.99 a pint at Kroger!
I had to restrain myself from buying all of it yesterday, especially since they had birthday cake in stock!

There is a "Chiropractic neurologist" near my parents house who tries to present himself as a comparable alternative to a "traditional" neurologist.
According to his website, he treats ADHD, autism, dementia, SEIZURES, migraines and he REHABILITATES STROKE PATIENTS. There was a lot of other quackery on there but I got too angry and had to go take some deep breaths.
I'm a fan of Powerade zero, though its a little strong so a lot of times I'll cut it with water for a more subtle flavor.

Yess!
I usually drink my coffee black or with 1 packet of Splenda (and I like it that way) but I do like the occasional crazy Starbucks drink as a dessert.
I just don't get how people can drink them every day!
My school would "recommend" that pregnant girls "transfer" to the alternative school that was "better equipped to meet their needs"
Ooh what you recommend for me? I don't care about temperature but I like things lightly sweetened with a lot of caffeine.
I mean you had bare legs, what else would you have been doing?

I don't know what you're doing at the hospital but I wouldn't recommend those. Hospitals are DIRTY and you are going to want shoes that you can scrub off with a Lysol wipe before letting them anywhere near your living space.
Plus, even if you aren't exposed to bodily fluids, people spill drinks and drop things. You are better off with leather or vinyl shoes for a hospital IMO
He was a super sweet kid and his parents sent him to camp with a private duty nurse so we were able to just focus on helping him have a good time!
One of the kids at the summer camp I worked at this summer had ROHHAD syndrome.

Apparently I'm most like the average woman in Vietnam which I find funny because I'm on the tall side for an American woman.
Then again, I apparently have a lower BMI than 94% of American women in my age group.
C3, C4, C5 keeps the diaphragm alive!

Oooh tell me more about your adaptation of Spring Awakening, that sounds super interesting!
I think it is one of my favorite shows because it can be taken in so many different directions.
Maybe they were thinking you'd grow a bit, and move somewhere cold and rainy so you'd need room for layers under your coat?

Deutsche Welle (its like German NPR) has a lot of good stuff for German language learners; they have their articles in both German and English and they have the "slow news" which is read at a pace that you can follow along with the transcript.

I've been really lucky to have a lot of awesome teachers but the one that stands out the most is my 8th grade honors US history teacher.
She was the definition of 'firm but fair'; she made her expectations clear and expected students to meet and exceed them but she was willing to bend over backwards to make sure that everyone was able to perform up to their potential.
I was going through a rough time and she was always there to support me and help me stay on track but she never lowered her expectations because she knew what I was capable of. She allowed me to struggle and fail and showed me that I could work hard and doing poorly on one test wasn't the end of the world and one bad grade didn't mean I was dumb and unworthy. She truly made me feel valued and loved when I felt really alone in the world and she created a classroom environment where it was cool to be smart.

I moved into my first apartment this week!
I struggle with anorexia and I feel like I made a lot of big strides this summer; I worked 40 hours a week and finally took responsibility for planning and preparing my own meals because I am a grown ass adult and its unfair to make my mom pack my lunches. I've gotten over my fear of cooking to a degree and I started lifting (I used to just do cardio) so I'm motivated to eat to fuel the gainz. I'm feeling ready to adult!
I am a bit nervous as I am at a "borderline" weight, I feel fine and people keep telling me how great I look (I've gained muscle) but I know that if I lose a pound or 2 I could end up in medical trouble or just spiral back down into disorder but I have too much at stake to let that happen.
Last semester I ended up in the hospital and I almost had to withdraw for treatment but I stuck it out and now I feel like I'm ready to fully live. I don't know what this rant is, but I'm proud of myself and I think I might be able to do this and I wanted to share with someone.

I really didn't really understand binging until I was in eating disorder treatment (I have anorexia) and met people who really struggled with this behavior.
Binging isn't just eating something because it tastes good and then regretting it; I know people who would be so out of control they would binge on condiments or still frozen pizzas if they ran out of edible food mid binge. Its a compulsive behavior; people who binge don't enjoy it, they binge because they don't know what else to do to deal with whatever they are feeling when they are triggered.
Ooh have you ever tried it with relish?
I was thinking that or white Converse high tops maybe?
I really like North Face backpacks; I know they aren't the most stylish but they are super durable and distribute weight really well.

What kind of shoes would look good with [this](https://www.ae.com/women-aeo-printed-button-front-romper-navy/web/s-prod/0397_9344_410?cm=sUS-cUSD catId=cat6270219) romper (I have the 'cream' one)?
I'm planning to wear it to a concert tonight then walk to a party tonight, so I need shoes that are decent to walk in (so not Birks or wedges)

The custodians at my elementary school were seriously the nicest guys; they would always go out of their way to be helpful to teachers and parents and they were really good with us kids. Its been 10 years and I still remember how awesome those guys were!
We're boob twins!

Can we all just agree that 'belly' is the acceptable name of that region?
'Abdomen' is accurate, but sounds pretentious in casual conversation, 'torso' is too broad of a term and 'stomach' is inaccurate unless you are specifically talking about that organ.

And there are shades of grey. Docs won't operate on people they know or treat them in any long term way but its not uncommon to do basic stuff from time to time (sign off on physicals, write for abx for a straight forward infection or spot a refill of a longterm control) as a professional courtesy.

It gets a little murky when you work in a hospital because odds are you are at least familiar with most of the staff.
The gender of the chaperone doesn't really matter, they are just a third party witness who is there to protect the patient and practitioner.
A lot of times it is someone of the same gender as the patient but sometimes you just have to grab whoever is available.
I just stick everything in a little tote bag (the small ones you get when you buy stuff at Lululemon) since everything goes right into the fridge when I get to work.

I like the Lululemon TaTa Tamer 2 and the Brooks Rebound Racer for higher impact stuff.
I also like the plain old Nike compression bras; they aren't great for running but they keep my boobs contained and give good enough support for crosstraining (elliptical and stairmaster) or lifting.

Eating.
I don't enjoy it and it is a major time suck.
Because I don't really want to eat and I am almost never hungry I feel like I have to spend a lot more time planning out meals and snacks.

I've had people say that carrots and peanut butter is weird but I've always eaten them together.
I also mix peanut butter into my oatmeal instead of using sugar.
Also, Smart Food white cheddar popcorn and whatever terrible white wine I have is a match made in heaven.

THIS ONE.
Like, I don't want to be sick but I can't say that I'm happy that recovery involves gaining weight. I hate that I hate being told that I look "healthy" but yeah.

I feel you girl.
It is just such an awkward thing because there isn't much that you can do about it. The people who I am close with are pretty good but I can't do anything about the random girls I meet at parties or the people I know in passing at work who make these well intentioned but uncomfortable comments.
I don't get comments like this because even if you were purging it would be super weird for someone to bring up your serious mental illness in such a casual way!

Ugh. As someone who struggles with an eating disorder I wish people would just stop with unsolicited body comments.
My personal rule is that I don't comment on a persons weight unless they have told me that they are trying to change something. Obviously I want to recognize my friends progress and hard work but it is just weird to comment on another persons body without them giving you some kind of cue (telling you about their weight loss goals) that they are ok with it.

My running shoes which are $120 (I have super flat feet and they are the only shoes that work for me. I only where them when I run and wear cheaper shous to crosstrain or lift)
Lululemon leggings (I buy a pair or 2 every year and since they hold up well I have a pretty decent collection)
A niceish sports bra that keeps by 28F boobs in place (it probably cost 50 or 60 bucks, having big boobs is expensive)
I do have some nicer workout tops, but I also wear t-shirts and tanks that I have lying around from different events/races.
So I may have exaggerated a bit but yeah.

I can "play" a lot of instruments because I have good pitch and can read music, but my primaries are violin and classical voice.
I played pretty seriously until middle school when I had a school orchestra teacher who was so bad he made me hate playing and I made it into an honors orchestra and was last chair. I was also the absolute youngest person but I figured that this was a sign that I wasn't as good as people said I was and I just started slacking because I figured if I wasn't the best in a local youth orchestra I was hopeless.

Your blood work being in the range of normal doesn't nesecarilly mean you are healthy, it just means your body is able to compensate for the unhealthy things that you are doing to it.
I used my "normal" blood work as a way to stay in denial of the seriousness of my eating disorder; obviously I was completely healthy if none of my labs were critical! The thing is, when tests start to come back abnormal its not "time to start make some changes", it is "time to get in this hospital bed before you literally drop dead"

It is pretty great!
My head isn't fully "shaved", I get it cut super close then let it grow out for a month or 2 because I'm cheap then repeat.
I save money on shampoo, I personally think I look more feminine and I love the way that I look, so I really don't care about the rare negative comment from a stranger.

I don't feel bad about how much I spend on workout clothes because I get good use out of them and I am don't spend a lot on the rest of my wardrobe so it balances out.
Like yes, what I wore to the gym was probably valued at at least $400 (including shoes) but that is how much my entire business wardrobe cost.

A lot of things relating to my boyfriend when we are home for the summer. We have been together for a long time and my mom really likes him so she knows that "stuff" is happening but doesn't want to hear about it.
My mom only asked for "plausible deniability" when it came to what we were doing; she wasn't opposed but she also just didn't want to know when and where we were doing it. We "watch" a lot of movies and she goes on a lot of veerrrrry long, loudly announced evening walks.

I had kind of the opposite; I broke my arm falling down some stairs and my mom REFUSED to believe that I hadn't been pushed (or something).
I was being bullied and I did lie about it a lot because I didn't want my parents involved but I was also pretty clumsy soo.

At 9, a lot of kids (especially girls) eat crazy amounts and might plump up a bit because they are starting puberty and are about to shoot up in height, and they do need to gain some body fat to start menstruating.
If her parents aren't fat and your boyfriend isn't fat she is probably just going through a chunky phase which is normal for kids her age! 90 pounds isn't even far outside the range of normal for kids her age, especially since you say that she is on the tall side.
I'm not trying to be fatlogicy but there is still hope for her!
I mean atypical anorexia is a real thing but yeah thats what it is in this context.

Yup! I have several friends from treatment who had the atypical diagnosis; their thoughts and behaviors were deeply disordered but they developed their disorder at a higher weight so the were not clinically underweight.
Their illness is no less valid or serious than anorexia (which I have) its just different.

I totally feel you. I've never been a food motivated person, I struggle with anorexia and I have celiac disease so a lot of things aren't an option for me. I honestly just tell people that I don't want to eat but I will gladly come along to enjoy their company and nurse a Diet Coke. It takes a while but people get used to it and a lot of times feel flattered that you are just coming to see them :)
Chairs with hard backs are the worst because they dig into my illiac crest and vertebrae.

I don't have bulimia (I have anorexia with purging, so I don't binge), but I hope I can be helpful! I would say it was/is pretty bad, there have been times when I would purge everything I was made to eat.
When I want to purge I tell myself that I have to wait 10-15 minutes then I can do whatever I want. Purging is still an option so I don't have anxiety like I do when I can't purge, but I have to wait and usually once that time has passed I am engaged in something else or far enough removed from the emotion of eating to be more rational.
I have been to treatment many times; inpatient, residential, IOP, PHP and outpatient and I really recommend seeking a higher level of care if you think that it would be helpful.
Every so often Costco will have Snapware sets for super cheap, so keep your eye out!
Thats what med students are for!

Ok but there is a huge different between people who try to feed their kids a healthy, balanced diet and the people who will LOSE THEIR SHIT if their kid has a handful of Goldfish or non-organically grown produce.

Compulsive exercise is kind of hard to explain because there are people who exercise intensely everyday who aren't compulsive.
As a compulsive exerciser I think the distinction comes down to choice: I don't always want to exercise but I HAVE to or I feel like something terrible will happen and I have serious anxiety if I am in a situation where I won't be able to do my usual routine.

Yup!
I have been gone from the middle of the healthy weight range to severely underweight and my breast size did not change.

Yup! My mom and I both have really big boobs that are primarily composed of fibrous tissue which means they don't sag, but they don't really change with weight loss.
Mine are not proportional to the rest of me and it is a pain to be an other wise lean, lanky person with 28F boobs.

Yup! I'm recovering from anorexia and it is HARD to be at a "healthy" BMI and still be told that I need to gain weight.
I got my wisdom teeth out and went from "very bottom end of healthy BMI probably still kind of underweight for my height" to "in the hospital on 24/7 cardiac monitoring"

I know a fair amount of small adults who ride large ponies.
TBH ponies aren't that great for kids because they are stubborn and can be kind of cranky; I know a lot of people (myself included) who learned to ride on older full sized horses because they were mellow and could basically go on "autopilot" which is great when you are just learning to steer.

This happened to my sister (though her having a physical illness was never taken off the table), and her doctors weren't asshats like the ones your poor sister got stuck with.
I can't really blame the doctors though (in her case); they are trained to look for the most likely solution and when you have a teenage girl who is quickly losing weight and has a sibling (me) with a diagnosed eating disorder its not an unreasonable diagnosis to make especially when most likely medical conditions have been ruled out.
Eating disorders can cause gastroparesis and GI conditions can trigger eating disorders (I had several friends in treatment who had eating disorders that developed as a way to feel "in control" of their medical condition) which makes this messy. They should have ruled out an ED at some point; but by having her talk to a therapist to make sure her thoughts weren't disordered, not by torturing her with treatment that she didn't want or need.

I do think that content based tests are a fair way to assess people and I say that as someone with severe test anxiety. The fact is, testing works for the vast majority of people and there is no way to have something that is ideal for every single person.
Most state schools that I applied to didn't really seem to care about the SAT and ACT unless your score was extremely above or below average. I know a few people who were probably offered a few more scholarship dollars because of their excellent scores but I don't know anyone who was hurt by their average scores if they were an otherwise desirable candidate.

I do agree that there are a lot of issues with out current system of standardized testing; we start testing too young and it is complete bull that teacher pay can be linked to scores, but I also think that people get WAY too bent out of shape about it.
Test scores don't really mean much in college admissions unless you are trying to get into an Ivy. Excellent scores may help you a little or get you some money, but you have to do really terrible to be hurt by your SAT score if the rest of your transcript is ok.

After my first semester of college.
My parents are still my parents and they do tell me to do things when I am home but they mostly trust me to keep myself alive and offer more guidance and advice than actual instruction.

"You can't go to a hardware store and be mad that they can't sell you a gallon of milk"
This is something a therapist said to me about creating a support network. Basically, no one person is equipped to fulfill all of your needs, a person may have a lot of useful things to offer you but if they are not equipped to give you what you need in a moment it is unfair of you to expect them to provide you with something that they don't have.

I think we as a society are losing our ability to tolerate any kind of physical or emotional discomfort and that really worries me. I hate it when people say that my generation is "soft" but I really do think that we as a society need to learn to suck it up sometimes because life isn't always fun or completely in line with how we want things to be.
Sometimes, life is uncomfortable; we all have to do boring things, deal with annoying people and do things that we just don't want to do. It is completely ok to have feelings of discomfort but they are something that we need to learn to accept as a temporary part of life that we just have to deal with.

Yup! My mom made it her goal to "not let me look like I had a white mom"
We grew up far away from the black side of my family so my mom would go up to random black women in the grocery store and ask them what to do with my hair (I was born in the mid-90s so the internet wasn't much of a thing yet).

None, for my current job. I work as a summer camp counselor, so I swim every morning then I spend most of my day outside getting sweaty.
Plus, I really don't care what a whole bunch of 6 year olds think about my appearance.

My food. I'm recovering from anorexia and I like to log what I eat but I tend to get really compulsive about writing things down so I just take pictures so I can keep track and have a visualization of how much I'm eating.

Turkey jerky since it has a good amount of protein, and I have super low blood pressure so sodium isn't an issue for me.
Yasso frozen yogurt bars for a treat
String cheese, a bag of Skinny Pop and a piece of fruit
Oatmeal topped with nut butter and sometimes a little honey
Trail mix
The cereal of your choice with plain, nonfat Greek yogurt instead of milk (if I'm using a cereal that isn't super sweet I might add a little honey).
Tuna and carrot sticks
Carrots and peanut butter

My mom has a crazy amount of cucumbers from her garden so I have been eating a lot of cucumber salad lately! We'll have to try this recipe; usually she makes an Asian style one that tastes like pickles!
There is a chiro near me who claims to be a "chiropractic neurologist" and treats ADHD, depression and SEIZURES!

I'm sure that there are some decent chiros but I refuse to see one because nothing that they believe is based in any kind of science. Plus, it just feels really shady to me that they refer to themselves as "doctors". I know that not all doctors are physicians but someone I know was recently telling me about the "chiropractic neurologist" that she has been seeing.
I go to school in SE Ohio and it really surprised me how southern people sound there!

Try to see food as a neutral thing; if you are not in a place to enjoy it just think of it as something that has to be done at certain times. Schedule times to eat and stick to them. Go for things that are nutrient dense so that you can eat a smaller volume and still get a decent number of calories.
I would also recommend drinking some of your calories; ideally you should drink things that also have nutrients (lowfat milk, smoothies, protein shakes), but if all you can stomach is juice or a can of pop that is better than nothing.

If you live near a university or community college, contact them! Many have official programs that match families with students and others will pass your info on to professors in relevant majors.
I am a nursing major and I have several friends who work for families who contacted our department looking for someone to watch their kids with more complex medical needs (they didn't need "nursing care" but parents felt more comfortable having someone who had some experience with giving meds or just recognizing a potential emergency).

I only recently became a sweaty person and I have a WEIRD amount of head sweat. Maybe its because I have super short hair (basically a buzz cut) so it doesn't get absorbed? When I do turns in ballet I basically became a sweat sprinkler.

Boyfriends Junior Prom: About $180
My Junior Prom: $0 (my schools theatre department let us go through all of the stuff that people donated and I found an awesome dress that fit me)
Boyfriends Senior Prom: $550
My Senior Prom: $600
The 2 ludicrously expensive dresses were more my moms doing than my own, I never really asked for much so she really wanted to make me feel special and get me my 'dream' dresses.
My boyfriends mom is a shitlord OBGYN and according to her you just have to dig around until you find it.

Those videos were so counterproductive; kids who don't have that mentality don't get anything and kids (like me) who have or are headed towards an eating disorder learn the "tricks of the trade".
Middle school health class made me a better anorexic.

There is evidence showing that people of Indian decent have greater than average levels of insulin resistance and stronger genetic predispositions for T2D which makes it even more important that she eat better!
I work at a summer camp for elementary school aged kids and it BLOWS MY MIND how many of them ask to be picked up.

I assumed that it was; I worry that the 1 semester I have to take won't be enough!
My program also requires genetics so I did a double take when I saw this question.

If someone is starting off with a higher BMI (whether they are overweight or just on the larger side of normal) they can lose a significant amount of weight and become malnourished before they reach an underweight BMI.

Now they use the diagnosis "atypical anorexia" (which is considered a subcategory within the EDNOS/OSFED umbrella) for people who have all of the behavioral and psychological symptoms but are not underweight.
I honestly think its a really helpful label to use as EDNOS is so freaking broad.

We just weren't nude for that scene because we had a few underage cast members, and our director didn't think that the nudity added much to the production as he envisioned it.
I'm glad it was a positive experience for you!

I'm female, 5'8'' and about 120 pounds.
I honestly have nothing against fat people, but as someone who is studying nursing I am really concerned about obesity as a public health crisis. I don't know how I found this sub but gosh darn do I enjoy raging at bad science with you Shitlords and ladies
At my school, the stereotype is that nurses marry engineers!

I am in therapy and I see my doctor pretty regularly because a lot of my medical stuff is kind of 'borderline' (heart rate, weight and BP at the very low ends of normal) plus I was hospitalized in January for electrolyte imbalances so we need to keep an eye on that.
Honestly; I've been in therapy for 7 years and while it is still helpful I know what I need to do I just can't make myself do it if that makes any sense.
I'm really glad I'm not the only person who feels this way!

My eating disorder. I've struggled with anorexia since I was 13 (though I had disordered thoughts and behaviors from a much younger age) and I'm so scared that I will never be able to fully recover.
Right now I'm doing well enough medically that nobody is forcing treatment, but my thoughts are still super disordered and in reality I'm a bad week away from being back in a hospital bed.
I have SO many great things going on in my life right now and my eating disorder has the potential to ruin everything, but I am so scared to do the things I need to do to get to a healthier place. I can't just drop everything and go to treatment but at a certain level I know that I can't do this on my own.

Eating disorder behaviors.
I don't want to restrict my food intake, compulsively exercise and purge, but I feel like I have to.
Also: WHY DO THE AIRBAGS NEVER DEPLOY???
Mine always jokes that she is "too old to buy green bananas"
How does he get away with not bringing the dog to the hospital? Every agency that we have talked to is very clear that if you are given a service dog it needs to go everywhere with you.

Most reputable service dog trainers will not give you a dog unless you take it EVERYWHERE with you. The idea is you are either disabled or you aren't so the if you need a dog you need it all of the time. We are in the process of having my younger sister evaluated for a service dog and all of the trainers we have met with have told us that the dog should only be away from its person for its designated exercise and play times.

I only commit to exercising for 10 minutes; if I'm really not feeling it after that I can stop, but I've found that half of the battle is just getting myself to start.
I also just make working out part of my routine to the point that it just doesn't feel like an option. I workout most days after work (I am luck that I work at the YMCA so I don't even have to go anywhere) and going to the gym has just become the next step in my daily routine.

Some really high quality, well fitted black skinny jeans. I usually wear them with a nice tunic style top and seasonally appropriate shoes and they look great for non-business dressy occasions (I've worn them to church and gotten compliments!)

Mine actually grew when I was severely underweight from an eating disorder! They're very dense (barely any fatty tissue) and my doctor said it was probably due to the hormonal imbalances caused by having super low body fat and being malnourished.

She is an incredible product and brand, but she just doesn't seem like an actual human being to me. She seems like a persona that was manufactured to appeal to a target demographic; while she clearly is saavy she comes off as super fake and boring.
People who put sugar on strawberries: WHY ARE YOU RUINING AN ALREADY DELICIOUS FRUIT???

It sounds like an urban legend, but I swear to God that I recently met a child whose legal name is K.I.D.
It stands for "Kindness, Integrity, Determination"

Frozen tikka masala from Trader Joe's.
I'm living at home for the summer and I really miss the Indian place across the street from my apartment at school.
I've had so much CHOP food that no matter the quality I never want to see it again!

I'm with you in theory but as someone who struggles with anorexia, I find it kind of hard to see the calorie counts when I'm trying to pick a meal. Obviously this is a 'me' problem and I need to learn to deal because I'm a grown ass woman, but I wish there was a way to ask for a menu without that info or something.
